content:
Not sure if this is the correct stream, but here we go.

We are looking to create a set of IGs to publish as packages. The IGs will be fairly small, one per domain, in order to have separate release-pipelines, versioning and dependencies.

From the registry doc.:

DIY: Create your own package feed and add it to the list of package feeds:
- Create an RSS feed (template at http://hl7.org/fhir/package-feed.xml)
- Register the package feed in https://github.com/FHIR/ig-registry/blob/master/fhir-ig-list.json (by making a GitHub PullRequest. The package -server will regularly check the RSS feed for new packages.

The IG development is done on GitHub and new releases are created using GitHub's release management including changelog and NPM Package.

The current plan is to create a github-action to trigger on release events and generate a XML according to the Fhir package RSS feed template. This xml is hosted on github and can be registered as a package feed in the fhir-ig-list.json as mentioned in the registry doc.

Such a solution should integrate well in our current CI\CD pipeline. However, I'm concerned after finding only 11 registered feeds in the fhir-ig-list since this indicates that creating your own feed is not a common practice. I'm also curious about the package-restrictions and guides lists because they are not mentioned in the registry doc., do we need to populate them as well?

actually we are moving that stuff to packages-list.json instead of fhir-ig-list.json, since they are separate things. You need to make PRs to both - once for your package feed, and to fhir-ig-list.json each time you release a new milestone version - it's kind of your summary of status
package-restrictions, you can use that to specify that no one else can publish packages in your namespace

Thanks for the reply @Grahame Grieve, hopefully you can clarify some things for me.

Feeds and package-restrictions are being moved to package-feed.json and guides will be the only element remaining in fhir-ig-list.json. Feeds and package-restrictions are still available in both, but his is only during a "transition period"?

Why do I need to populate the guides element, what is it used for? This seems to somewhat overlap with what is provided in package-feed.xml.

Can you clarify milestone release? We want to continuously release new versions of multiple packages\IGs, at least minor and patch (SemVer), do we need to update the fhir-ig-list.json every time? We want to automate as much as possible.

Considering there only being 11 other registered feeds; is there anything wrong with our approach? Are there alternatives, except from Simplifier?
yes only during the transition period until all the people using it tell me that they've changed

The guides element drives this: http://www.fhir.org/guides/registry/. That's it's sole purpose. And that is built around the idea of periodic milestones. It doesn't really handle continuous new releases. and the guides do contain information that can't be built from what's available in the packages feed
Ok, thanks @Grahame Grieve , we will continue on this path.
Eirik Myklebost has marked this topic as resolved.
